intro: Syngramma trichophora, commonly known as the hairy leaf mallow, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. The plant's structure includes alternate leaves with lobed margins and a branching stem system. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in native plant gardens.
